{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question describes a 62-year-old man with positive fecal occult blood tests, no symptoms, normal physical exams, and a polyp in the descending colon. The excisional biopsy of the polyp shows 75% tubular architecture. Based on this information, we need to determine which type of polyp is most likely to have this characteristic. According to the relevant documents, tubular adenomas are neoplastic polyps that can undergo malignant degeneration. They are also the most common type of polyp found in the colon. Since the biopsy shows 75% tubular architecture, it is likely that the polyp is a tubular adenoma.", "answer_choice": B}
